The plants are characterized by their striking blue or violet flowers, which are typically tubular in shape and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tacazzea species are often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where they play a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to their limited distribution and habitat specificity, many Tacazzea species are considered vulnerable to environmental changes.
